    • Our Special

      • Yields: Approximately 25-30 ladoos

      Ingredients

      • 1 cup besan (gram flour)
      • 1/2 cup ghee (clarified butter)
      • 1/4 cup sugar
      • 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder
      • 1/4 teaspoon saffron strands, soaked in warm milk
      • 1/4 cup chopped pistachios, for garnish
      Instructions

      Prepare the besan

      In a large bowl, sift the besan to remove any lumps.

      Heat the ghee

      In a heavy-bottomed pan, heat the ghee over medium heat until it starts to bubble.

      Roast the besan

      Add the besan to the hot ghee and stir continuously. Keep roasting until the besan turns golden brown and starts to release a nutty aroma. This process may take 15-20 minutes.

      Add sugar

      Once the besan is roasted, add the sugar and continue to stir. The sugar will melt and combine with the besan, forming a sticky mixture.

      Add cardamom and saffron

      Stir in the cardamom powder and the saffron-infused milk.

      Form the ladoos

      Remove the mixture from the heat and let it cool slightly. Once cool enough to handle, use your palms to form small, round ladoos.

      Garnish and serve

      Roll the ladoos in chopped pistachios and serve immediately.

      Tips

      To ensure the ladoos are crispy, make sure the besan is roasted to a deep golden brown.

      If the mixture is too sticky, add a little more besan to make it easier to handle.

      For a richer flavor, you can add a bit of khoya (milk solids) to the mixture.
